title: Problem-Based Learning Program for Surgical Leadership Development and Diversity Promotion

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical field knowledge and professional work experience
context.additional_context: A non-real-time online course operating in a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment, focusing on solving leadership and diversity issues in real surgical practice through project-based assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three leadership strategies that promote diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) in surgical care environments
Learners can analyze surgical leadership cases through problem-based learning (PBL) and propose team-based solutions
Learners can apply the ADDIE model to design and evaluate DEI training modules in real-world projects

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
